page.title: 03Churches
page.content: a half legs and much of the canopy has gone,but what remains is of high quality.However,the memorable feature of this church is the tomb of Sir Rodger de Kerdiston in the north east corner of the chancel.The large mailed figure lies on a bed cobbles,possibly of some allegorical significance.One hand is on the sword,and his feet rest on a very large lion.The Font in Reepham church is made of Purpeck Marble.It may have been polished but it does not shine at the moment.It is Norman and stands at the end of the church beneath the west window.It has a pattern on its side showing Norman arches.There is an old Alms box which was used to raise money for the poor people in the parish.It is made of strong oak and Iron straps which makes the box even stronger.
